intro: Ventia crocea, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Ventia crocea thrives in sandy soils and is often found along sea cliffs and dunes, where it plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
